intro: Sclerolobium radlkoferi, commonly known as the African broom, is a shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellowish or orange flowers that appear in clusters, followed by flat, pod-like fruits. It is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showing resistance to drought. The bark is thick and fissured, providing some protection against fire and pests.
